column3: Shell Exploration & Production Co. will spend $1.3 billion to develop the six-field Na Kika prospect in the deepwater Gulf of Mexico
using a floating production facility, a first for the Gulf, the Company said on Wednesday.  The Na Kika project will be producing oil
and natural gas from record depths of more than 7,000 feet.  Shell Exploration and Production and BP each have a 50 percent stake
in the project, which is estimated to hold the equivalent of about 300 million barrels of oil.
Republican lawmakers vowed to block the Clinton administration from releasing oil from the U.S. Strategic Petroleum Reserve.
"The Strategic Petroleum Reserve exists to be used in states of national emergency, not on a whim of political debates or economic
Shell Oil Co. and Texaco both reached settlements on Thursday with the U.S. Department of Justice over claims that they underpaid
royalties for oil and natural gas produced on federal and Native American land.  Shell Oil agreed to pay $56 million to settle the
claims and Texaco agreed to pay $43 million.  The royalties are based on oil produced on leased land from 1980 to 1998.
